Texas Education Agency
AUSTIN, TEXAS
• STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION
• STATE COMMISSIONER OF EDUCATION
• STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION
AIR MAIL
January 31, 1957
Dr* Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Dr. Skornia:
We are very glad to have your letter of January 17 addressed
to our Commissioner of Education, Dr. J. W. Edgar. As you
can well imagine, those of us in Texas are very glad to tell
other people of the project we are now conducting in the field
of teacher recruitment and education by television. We believe
the project has been very successful thus far, and we are now
looking forward to continuing it during a second year. We heard
from Dr. Eurich yesterday, telling us that the Board of the Fund
has just approved our application for a second year. This, of
course, makes all of us very happy and we are making ambitious
plans for continuing the project.
I am enclosing a copy of the Project Statement which has changed
to a slight degree in some areas since the program started in
September. It was on this statement that we based our begin¬
ning; however, we do feel that we have made considerable progress
during the first six months. We shall be very glad to send you
as much information as is now available, and if you will send me
one of your Fact Sheets, we shall be glad to complete it. This
will guide me in knowing more directly what you would like to
have said about the project.
I am looking forward to seeing you again at Dectona Beach early
in June.
Sincerely yours,
Lee Wilborn
Assistant Commissioner
for Instruction
